• Policy Title: Coverage Guidelines for Positive Airway Pressure (PAP) Devices
• Policy Effective Date: 2024-12-01
• Policy Version: 1.0
• Applicable Condition: Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA)
• Devices Included:
   - Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP) (Code: E0601)
   - Bi-level Respiratory Assist Device without Backup Rate (Code: E0470)

coverageCriteria.description: Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP) Device Coverage
criteria:
• A: Beneficiary has an in-person clinical evaluation by the treating practitioner prior to the sleep test to assess for obstructive sleep apnea.
• B: Beneficiary has a sleep test that meets one of the following:
   - (1) Apnea-Hypopnea Index (AHI) or Respiratory Disturbance Index (RDI) ≥ 15 events per hour with a minimum of 30 events.
   - (2) AHI or RDI between 5 and 14 events per hour (minimum 10 events) with documentation of one or more of the following:
       a. Excessive daytime sleepiness, impaired cognition, mood disorders, or insomnia.
       b. Hypertension, ischemic heart disease, or history of stroke.
• C: Beneficiary and/or caregiver has received instruction from the device supplier in proper use and care of the equipment.
coverageCriteria.nonComplianceNote: • If a claim for an E0601 device is submitted and all criteria above have not been met, it will be denied as not reasonable and necessary.

coverageCriteria.description: Bi-level Respiratory Assist Device (without backup rate) Coverage
criteria:
• Prerequisites: Beneficiary must meet all criteria A–C for E0601.
• D: E0601 has been tried and proven ineffective based on a therapeutic trial conducted in a facility or home setting.
coverageCriteria.ineffectiveDefinition: • Documented failure to meet therapeutic goals using E0601 during titration in a facility-based study or during home use despite optimal therapy (proper mask selection, fitting, and appropriate pressure settings).
